newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - April 21.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - April 21.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:
North and MIM were understood to have broadened their regular talks over their Alumbrera joint venture to include merger discussions, The Australian newspaper said.
Westpac Managing Director Bob Joss is due to give a Securities Institute briefing after 12.30 p.m. (0230 GMT).
* Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd A$17.16 (+0.26)

The workers' union at Escondida copper mine representing 17 percent of the mine's workforce has begun a legal strike at the pit in northern Chile but the stoppage won't hit operations, the company said on Saturday.

Gold explorer Arcadia Minerals Ltd on Sunday released new drilling results from the Mount Olympus gold prospect in Western Australia which it said were very encouraging. The Mount Olympus lode, which is owned by the Dublin Hill joint venture, was up to 150 metres wide and had been extended for an additional 300 metres from the crest of Mt Olumpus, Arcadia said. Arcadia owns 30 percent of Dublin Hill while Sipa owns 70 percent.

The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) said on Friday it had written to major tobacco firms seeking an explanation about recent media reports of industry co-operation on tobacco product pricing.

Carpenter Pacific Resources NL said on Friday that the latest drilling results from its Mout Kare gold project in Papua New Guinea confirmed that the deposit was similar to the nearby Porgera gold mine. Carpenter said assay results showed gold of up to a massive 2,140.98 grams per tonne (g/t) and as low as 0.62 g/t.

Troy Resources NL on Friday released what it said were significant drilling results from its Cornishman Joint Venture in Western Australia with Sons of Gwalia Ltd, showing intercepts of up to 43 grams per tonne.
QBE and GIO strong last week as switching seen from banks to insurance in wake of Wallis fallout.
